MethodDescription Class Reference
[Entity]

This class is used to describe a method associated with an entity class. More...

Detailed Description

This class is used to describe a method associated with an entity class.

void MethodDescription::addToMD5 ( MD5 &  md5,
int  legacyExposedIndex 
) const

This method adds this object to the input MD5 object.

bool MethodDescription::addToStream ( bool  isFromServer,
PyObject *  args,
BinaryOStream &  stream 
) const

This method adds a method to the input stream.

It assumes that the arguments are valid, according to 'areValidArgs'. The method header will already have been put onto the stream by the time this is called, so we have to complete the message even if we put on garbage.

See also:
areValidArgs
Parameters:
isFromServer Indicates whether or not we are being called in a server component.
args A Python tuple object containing the arguments.
stream The stream to which the method call should be added.
Returns:
True if successful.

bool MethodDescription::areValidArgs ( bool  exposedExplicit,
PyObject *  args,
bool  generateException 
) const

This method checks whether the input tuple of arguments are valid to call this method with (by adding them to a stream).

See also:
addToStream
Parameters:
args A Python tuple object containing the arguments.
exposedExplicit Flag indicating whether or not the source for exposed methods is specified explicitly
generateException Flag indicating whether or not to generate a python exception describing the problem if the arguments are not valid.
Returns:
True if the arguments are valid.

bool MethodDescription::callMethod ( PyObject *  self,
BinaryIStream &  data,
EntityID  sourceID = 0,
int  replyID = -1,
const Mercury::Address *  pReplyAddr = NULL,
Mercury::NetworkInterface *  pInterface = NULL 
) const

This method calls the method described by this object.

Parameters:
self the object whose method is called
data the incoming data stream
sourceID the source object ID if it came from a client
replyID the reply ID, -1 if none
pReplyAddr the reply address or NULL if none
pInterface the nub to use, or NULL if none
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

PyObjectPtr MethodDescription::getArgsAsTuple ( BinaryIStream &  data,
EntityID  sourceID = 0,
int  replyID = -1,
const Mercury::Address *  pReplyAddr = NULL,
Mercury::NetworkInterface *  pInterface = NULL 
) const

This returns a tuple containing the arguments of the method described by this class.

Parameters:
data A stream containing the arguments for the call.
sourceID The ID to pass as the source of exposed method calls.
replyID the reply ID, -1 if none
pReplyAddr pointer to the reply address, or NULL if none
pInterface pointer to the interface to use for replies, or NULL if none
Returns:
A PyObjectPtr containing the arguments as a tuple.

bool MethodDescription::parse ( DataSectionPtr  pSection,
Component  component 
)

This method parses a method description.

Parameters:
pSection Datasection from which to parse the description.
component Indicates which component this method belongs to.
Returns:
True if the description was parsed successfully.

bool MethodDescription::parseReturnValues ( DataSectionPtr  pSection  ) 

This method parses a method description's return values, if it has any.

The presence of return values indicates that the method is two-way. No return values indicates a one-way call.

Parameters:
pSection the data section of the method's ReturnValues

float MethodDescription::priority (  )  const

This method returns the priority associated with this method.

It is used for deciding whether or not to send to the client.

WatcherPtr MethodDescription::pWatcher (  )  [static]

This method returns the generic watcher for Method Descriptions.
